1.text: Do you generally go into negotiations well prepared?

2.text: How uncomfortable do you feel when facing direct conflict?

options.c: Don't like it but face it

3.text: How do you look at negotiation?

options.b: Mostly competitive but a good part cooperative
options.c: Mostly cooperative but a good part competitive

4.text: What kind of deal do you go for?

options.a: A good deal for both parties
options.d: A very good deal for you and better than no deal for him

5.text: Do you like to negotiate with merchants (furniture, cars, major appliances)?

7.text: How do you feel about ambiguous situations – situations which have a good many pros and cons?

options.a: Very uncomfortable/Like things one way or another
options.c: Don't like it but can live with it
options.d: Undisturbed/Find it easy to live with
options.e: Like it that way/Things are hardly ever one way or another

8.text: How would you feel about negotiating a 10% raise with your boss if the average raise in the department is 5%?

options.a: Don't like it at all/Would avoid it
options.b: Don't like it but would make a pass at it reluctantly
options.c: Would do it with little apprehension
options.d: Make a good case and not afraid to try it
options.e: Enjoy the experience and look forward to it

9.text: How good is your business judgment?

options.a: Experience shows that it's very good
options.c: As good as most other executives
options.e: I hate to say it but I guess I'm not quite with it when it comes to business matters

10.text: When you have the power do you use it?

options.a: I use it to the extent I can
options.b: I use it moderately without any guilt feelings
options.c: I use it in behalf of fairness as I see fairness
options.d: I don't like to use it
options.e: I take it easy on the other fellow

11.text: How do you feel about getting personally involved with the other party?

options.d: I'm attracted to getting close to him
options.e: I go out of my way to get close/I like it that way

12.text: How sensitive are you to the personal issues facing the opponent in negotiation?

13.text: How committed are you to the opponent's satisfaction?

options.a: Very committed/I try to see that he doesn't get hurt
options.c: Neutral but I hope he doesn't get hurt

14.text: Do you carefully study the limits of the other man's power?

options.d: It's hard to do because I'm not him
options.e: I let things develop at the season

15.text: How do you feel about making a very low offer when you buy?

options.b: Not too good but I do it sometimes
options.d: I try it often and don't mind doing it
options.e: I make it a regular practice and feel quite comfortable

16.text: How do you usually give in?

options.c: About at the same pace he does
options.d: I try to move it along a little faster by giving more
options.e: I don't mind giving hefty chunks and getting to the point

17.text: How do you feel about taking risks that affect your career?

options.a: Take considerably larger risks than most people
options.b: Somewhat more risk than most people
options.d: Take slight risk on occasion but not much

18.text: How do you feel with those of higher status?

19.text: How well did you prepare for the negotiation of the last house or car you bought?

20.text: How well do you think when not under pressure (compared to your peers)?

21.text: How would you feel if you had to say, 'I don't understand that,' four times after four explanations?

options.d: Would do it without feeling too badly

22.text: How well do you handle tough questions in negotiations?

24.text: Are you close-mouthed about your business?

options.d: Tend to say more than I should

25.text: How confident are you about your knowledge in your own field or profession (compared to your peers)?

26.text: You are the buyer of some construction services. The design is changed because your wife wants something different. The contractor now asks for more money for the change. You need him badly because he's well into the job. How do you feel about negotiating the added price?

options.b: Ready to work it out but not anxious to
options.c: Don't like it but will do it
